item.title: My First Post
item.description: Hugo Blog https://gohugo.io/getting-started/quick-start/ https://gohugo.io/hosting-and-deployment/hosting-on-github/ https://cjolowicz.github.io/posts/hosting-a-hugo-blog-on-github-pages-with-travis-ci/ Remove a submodule you need to: Delete the relevant section from the .gitmodules file. Stage the .gitmodules changes git add .gitmodules Delete the relevant section from .git/config. Run git rm –cached path_to_submodule (no trailing slash). Run rm -rf .git/modules/path_to_submodule (no trailing slash). Commit git commit -m “Removed submodule " Delete the now untracked submodule files rm -rf path_to_submodule
